realworld.description: Assisted reproductive technologies rely on understanding meiosis

notes.title: Process Overview
points: Occurs in chloroplasts containing chlorophyll
Light-dependent and light-independent (Calvin cycle) reactions
Converts light energy into chemical energy (glucose)

notes.title: Factors Affecting Photosynthesis
points: Light intensity and quality
Carbon dioxide concentration
Temperature (optimal 20-35°C)
Water availability
Chlorophyll content

formulas.title: Photosynthesis Equation
formulas.formula: 6CO₂ + 12H₂O + Light → C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂ + 6H₂O
formulas.explanation: Carbon dioxide + Water + Light energy → Glucose + Oxygen + Water

realworld.title: Agriculture
realworld.description: Optimizing conditions for maximum photosynthesis in greenhouses

realworld.title: Climate Change
realworld.description: Forests as carbon sinks through photosynthesis

notes.title: Types of Respiration
points: Aerobic: Requires oxygen, produces more ATP
Anaerobic: Occurs in absence of oxygen, produces ethanol/CO₂ or lactic acid

notes.title: Stages of Respiration
points: Glycolysis: Cytoplasm, produces 2 ATP
Krebs Cycle: Mitochondria, produces 2 ATP
Electron Transport Chain: Inner mitochondrial membrane, produces 34 ATP

formulas.title: Aerobic Respiration
formulas.formula: C₆H₁₂O₆ + 6O₂ → 6CO₂ + 6H₂O + 38 ATP
formulas.explanation: Complete oxidation of glucose to release energy

formulas.title: Anaerobic Respiration
formulas.formula:
C₆H₁₂O₆ → 2C₂H₅OH + 2CO₂ + 2 ATP (in yeast)
C₆H₁₂O₆ → 2C₃H₆O₃ + 2 ATP (in muscles)
formulas.explanation: Incomplete breakdown of glucose without oxygen

realworld.title: Food Industry
realworld.description: Bread, yogurt, and alcohol production using yeast and bacteria

realworld.title: Storage
realworld.description: Controlling respiration rates to extend shelf life of fruits and vegetables

notes.title: Xylem Transport
points: Transports water and minerals from roots to leaves
Driven by transpiration pull and root pressure
Unidirectional (upward) movement

notes.title: Phloem Transport
points: Transports organic nutrients (sucrose) from leaves to other parts
Bidirectional movement (source to sink)
Uses pressure flow hypothesis

formulas.title: Transpiration Rate
formulas.formula: Rate of water loss (ml/m²/hour)
formulas.explanation: Measured using potometer, affected by light, humidity, temperature, and wind

realworld.title: Horticulture
realworld.description: Joining plant parts to combine desirable traits

realworld.title: Forestry
realworld.description: Monitoring water transport to assess tree health

notes.title: Major Plant Hormones
points: Auxins: Cell elongation, apical dominance (IAA)
Gibberellins: Stem elongation, seed germination
Cytokinins: Cell division, delay aging
Abscisic Acid: Stress hormone, seed dormancy
Ethylene: Fruit ripening, leaf abscission

notes.title: Applications
points: Weed control (synthetic auxins)
Fruit ripening control (ethylene)
Tissue culture (cytokinins and auxins)
Dwarf plants (gibberellin inhibitors)

formulas.title: Hormone Interactions
formulas.formula:
Auxin:Cytokinin ratio → Root/Shoot development
High Auxin:Gibberellin → Fruit development
formulas.explanation: Balance between hormones regulates plant growth

realworld.title: Agriculture

notes.title: Basic Concepts
points: Transmission of characters from parents to offspring
Genes: Units of heredity located on chromosomes
Alleles: Different forms of a gene
Genotype: Genetic makeup (e.g., TT, Tt, tt)
Phenotype: Observable characteristic (e.g., tall, short)

notes.title: Chromosomal Basis
points: Humans: 23 pairs of chromosomes (46 total)
Autosomes: 22 pairs (non-sex chromosomes)
Sex chromosomes: 1 pair (XX in females, XY in males)

formulas.title: Genotypic Ratio (Monohybrid Cross)
formulas.formula: 1:2:1 (Homozygous dominant : Heterozygous : Homozygous recessive)
formulas.explanation: Example: Tt × Tt → 1 TT : 2 Tt : 1 tt

formulas.title: Phenotypic Ratio (Dihybrid Cross)
formulas.formula: 9:3:3:1 (Dominant-Dominant : Dominant-Recessive : Recessive-Dominant : Recessive-Recessive)
formulas.explanation: Example: RrYy × RrYy → 9 R_Y_ : 3 R_yy : 3 rrY_ : 1 rryy

realworld.title: Medical Genetics
realworld.description: Understanding inheritance patterns of genetic disorders

realworld.title: Agriculture
realworld.description: Developing new crop varieties with desirable traits

notes.title: Mendel's Laws
points: Law of Dominance: One allele masks another
Law of Segregation: Alleles separate during gamete formation
Law of Independent Assortment: Genes for different traits separate independently

notes.title: Monohybrid Cross
points: Involves one trait (e.g., seed shape)
Parental generation (P): Pure lines (TT × tt)
F1 generation: All heterozygous (Tt)
F2 generation: 3:1 phenotypic ratio

notes.title: Dihybrid Cross
points: Involves two traits (e.g., seed shape and color)
F1 generation: Dihybrids (RrYy)
F2 generation: 9:3:3:1 phenotypic ratio
Demonstrates independent assortment

formulas.title: Punnett Square (Monohybrid)
formulas.formula:
T t
T TT Tt
t Tt tt
formulas.explanation: Shows possible gamete combinations

formulas.title: Number of Gamete Types
formulas.formula: 2ⁿ where n = number of heterozygous gene pairs
formulas.explanation: Example: AaBbCc produces 2³ = 8 types of gametes

realworld.description: Foundation for understanding genetic principles

realworld.title: Animal Husbandry
realworld.description: Improving livestock breeds using Mendelian principles

notes.title: Types of Variation
points: Heritable (genetic) variation: Results from mutations, recombination
Non-heritable (environmental) variation: Caused by environmental factors
Continuous variation: Range of phenotypes (e.g., height, weight)
Discontinuous variation: Distinct categories (e.g., blood groups)

notes.title: Sources of Variation
points: Mutation: Random changes in DNA
Genetic recombination: Crossing over during meiosis
Random fertilization: Unique combination of gametes
Environmental factors: Nutrition, climate, etc.

formulas.title: Genetic Variation
formulas.formula: Number of possible zygotes = (2ⁿ)²
formulas.explanation: n = haploid number of chromosomes (23 in humans)

realworld.title: Biodiversity

realworld.title: Forensics
realworld.description: Using genetic variations for identification

notes.title: Theories of Evolution
points: Lamarckism: Use and disuse, inheritance of acquired characters
Darwinism: Natural selection, survival of the fittest
Modern Synthesis: Combines genetics with natural selection

notes.title: Evidence for Evolution
points: Fossil record: Shows changes over time
Homologous structures: Similar structure, different function
Vestigial organs: Remnants of functional structures
Embryological evidence: Similar early development
Molecular biology: DNA and protein similarities

notes.title: Mechanisms of Evolution
points: Natural selection: Differential survival and reproduction
Genetic drift: Random changes in allele frequencies
Gene flow: Movement of genes between populations
Mutation: Source of new genetic variation

formulas.title: Hardy-Weinberg Principle
formulas.formula:
p² + 2pq + q² = 1
p + q = 1
formulas.explanation: p = frequency of dominant allele, q = frequency of recessive allele

Abiotic: Air, water, soil, sunlight, temperature, minerals

notes.title: Ecological Pyramids
points: Pyramid of Numbers: Number of organisms at each level
Pyramid of Biomass: Total biomass at each level
Pyramid of Energy: Energy content at each level

formulas.formula: Only 10% of energy is transferred to the next trophic level
formulas.explanation: 90% of energy is lost as heat and metabolic processes

formulas.title: Biomagnification
formulas.formula: Toxic concentration increases at higher trophic levels
formulas.explanation: Example: DDT in food chains

Non-renewable: Fossil fuels, minerals (finite supply)

notes.title: Causes and Launch
points: Jallianwala Bagh Massacre (1919) and Rowlatt Act (1919) created widespread anger
Khilafat Movement (1919-1924) for Caliph of Turkey united Hindus and Muslims
Gandhiji launched Non-Cooperation Movement in 1920 at Nagpur session of Congress
Aim: Attain Swaraj through non-violent means

notes.title: Program and Impact
points: Boycott of government schools, colleges, courts, and foreign goods
Surrender of titles and honors
Massive participation of students, teachers, lawyers, and farmers
Chauri Chaura incident (1922) led to withdrawal of the movement

points: Launched in 1930 after failure of 11-point demands to Lord Irwin
Gandhiji's 24-day, 240-mile march from Sabarmati to Dandi (March-April 1930)
Broke salt law by making salt at Dandi on April 6, 1930
Spread nationwide with people making salt and boycotting foreign goods

points: Launched on August 8, 1942 at Gowalia Tank Maidan, Bombay
Also called 'August Kranti' or 'August Movement'
Gandhi's call: 'Do or Die' for complete independence
Immediate arrest of all major leaders including Gandhi, Nehru, and Patel

Formation of parallel governments in Ballia, Tamluk, and Satara
Participation of students, workers, and peasants across India
Harsh British repression with over 100,000 arrests and 1,000 deaths

Three parallel ranges: Greater Himalayas (Himadri), Middle Himalayas (Himachal), and Shiwaliks
Highest peak: Mount Everest (8,848m) in Nepal, K2 (8,611m) in POK is highest in Indian territory
Important passes: Zoji La, Nathu La, and Shipki La

Vindhya and Satpura ranges form its northern boundary
Rich in mineral resources like iron, coal, and manganese

notes.title: Types of Fundamental Rights
points: Right to Equality (Articles 14-18): Equality before law, prohibition of discrimination
Right to Freedom (Articles 19-22): Freedom of speech, assembly, movement, etc.
Right against Exploitation (Articles 23-24): Prohibition of human trafficking, child labor
Right to Freedom of Religion (Articles 25-28): Freedom of conscience and religion
Cultural and Educational Rights (Articles 29-30): Protection of minority interests
Right to Constitutional Remedies (Article 32): Right to move to Supreme Court for enforcement

notes.title: Significance
points: Protect individual liberties against state action
Justiciable - can be enforced in courts
Not absolute - reasonable restrictions can be imposed
Can be suspended during National Emergency (except Articles 20-21)

formulas.title: Article Numbers
formulas.formula:
14-18: Right to Equality
19-22: Right to Freedom
23-24: Right against Exploitation
25-28: Right to Freedom of Religion

formulas.explanation: Article numbers and corresponding Fundamental Rights

formulas.title: Population Growth Rate
formulas.formula: Growth Rate (%) = [(Births - Deaths) + (Immigrants - Emigrants)] / Total Population × 100

formulas.formula: Doubling Time (years) = 70 / Annual Growth Rate (%)
